definition: door knocker (in the shape of a ring)

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
ring/hoop/loop/(chain) link/classifier for scores in archery etc/to surround/to encircle/to hem in

sentences.english: There was a big, metal door-knocker on Scrooge's door.
sentences.chinese: 在史高基的门上有一个巨大的，金属的门环。

sentences.english: The ringing of her neighbor knocker set her heart pounding.
sentences.chinese: 邻家的门环一声响，那更使她心头突地一跳。

sentences.english: There was nothing particular about the knocker on the door, except that it was very large.
sentences.chinese: 门上的门环没有什么特别的，只是很大而已。

sentences.english: When he put his key in the lock of the door, he did not see a knocker.
sentences.chinese: 当他把钥匙插入门锁时，并没有看到门环。

sentences.english: The rolled cigarette between his teeth completed the picture as he used the door knocker.
sentences.chinese: 像往常那样，他衔着卷烟，拍打了一下门环。

sentences.english: He brightens the brass knocker with a piece of cloth.
sentences.chinese: 他用一块布擦亮铜门环。

sentences.english: I felt loath to sully the gleaming brass knocker by handling it.
sentences.chinese: 我不愿意伸手去抓那闪亮的黄铜门环，怕把它弄脏。

sentences.english: I knocked hard on his door, but no one opened it.
sentences.chinese: 我使劲扣他家的门环，也不见有人来开门。

sentences.english: I ran up the steps and I tried the door and knocked with the knocker.
sentences.chinese: 我跑上台阶，想要开门，不停地扣着门环。

sentences.english: The salesman pounded the door knocker.
Let me do it, dear, he said, rapping the knocker vigorously.
sentences.chinese: 让我来吧，亲爱的，说着，他用力地敲着门环。

sentences.english: Painted vermilion, a large pair of copper door rings is usually fixed on the gate.
sentences.chinese: 大门通常被漆成大红色，门上有一对大铜门环。

definition: variant of 門閂|门闩[men2 shuan1]
horizontal bar to hold a door closed (made of wood or metal)/door bolt
door/the opening panel of a door
spirit wall (screen wall used to shield an entrance in traditional Chinese architecture)
a screen wall across the gate of a house (for privacy)
guardian lion, a lion statue traditionally placed at the entrance of Chinese imperial palaces, imperial tombs, temples etc
wooden or stone block supporting the axle of a door
